content:
• Monday, November 14, 2011
  • APC

    In a bullish sign for production, Anadarko Petroleum (NYSE:APC) says its Wattenberg lease in...

    In a bullish sign for production, Anadarko Petroleum (NYSE:APC) says its Wattenberg lease in Colorado could generate more than 1B barrels of oil equivalent - another major find after decades of declining domestic production. One of the keys? New techniques including horizontal wells, of which APC may drill 160 in the field's area during the next year, up from plans for 40. APC +1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 4 Comments
  • IOC

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) drops 6% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $281.9M (+35% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) drops 6% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $281.9M (+35% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.41, missing consensus by $47.9M and $0.40. A $15.1M loss in the company's oil production division was primarily responsible for the weak EPS figure. InterOil shares were crushed in September after Papua New Guinea's government drove the company to revise plans for a natural gas project.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • TEVA

    Development-stage drug company NuPathe (PATH) jumps after hours following a better than expected...

    Development-stage drug company NuPathe (PATH) jumps after hours following a better than expected Q3 report. The company also says it plans to resubmit its new drug application for its migraine-headache patch to the FDA in the first half next year. Shares +10.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • GERN

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) falls 12.7% AH after stating it's discontinuing further development of its...

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) falls 12.7% AH after stating it's discontinuing further development of its stem cell drug products, and will focus its resources on its cancer drug programs. As a result, Geron expects to cut 38% of its workforce. The company adds it's looking to find partners to "enable further development" of its stem-cell programs.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • MITK

    Shares of mobile imaging developer Mitek Systems (NASDAQ:MITK) are trading lower in the...

    Shares of mobile imaging developer Mitek Systems (NASDAQ:MITK) are trading lower in the post-trading session after its FQ4 revenue meets estimates, but its EPS falls short of estimates. Total revenues were up over 88% Y/Y on solid growth in its customer base, but higher SG&E and product launch expenses weighed on bottom-line results. Shares -8.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • DYAX

    Dyax (DYAX -7.3%) finishes the day lower after the company announced earlier today that it's...

    Dyax (DYAX -7.3%) finishes the day lower after the company announced earlier today that it's decided to withdraw its Marketing Authorization Application filed with the European Medicines Agency for its heridary angiodema drug Kalbitor.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • IBM

    It looks like Warren Buffett is officially comfortable with investing in tech: Bloomberg reports...

    It looks like Warren Buffett is officially comfortable with investing in tech: Bloomberg reports that, in addition to acquiring a stake in IBM, Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.A) has taken a position in Intel (NASDAQ:INTC). INTC +0.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 5 Comments
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK) drops 9.9% AH after issuing a major warning for the second straight quarter...

    LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK) drops 9.9% AH after issuing a major warning for the second straight quarter (previously). LDK now expects Q3 revenue of $460M-$470M, well below a $616.9M consensus. The company is also guiding for 2011 revenue of just $2.2B-$2.25B, compared with Street expectations of $2.5B. (JKS warning)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • BAC

    David Tepper's Appaloosa Management liquidates several of the financials of which he had been so...

    David Tepper's Appaloosa Management liquidates several of the financials of which he had been so bullish on. Today's 13F shows the fund - as of September 30 - completely exiting from Bank of America (NYSE:BAC), Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC), Fifth Third (NASDAQ:FITB), SunTrust (NYSE:STI), MetLife (NYSE:MET), and Hartford Financial (NYSE:HIG).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 5 Comments
  • LNG

    Cheniere Partners (NYSEMKT:LNG) finishes the day 7.4% higher after winning a $3.9B contract to...

    Cheniere Partners (NYSEMKT:LNG) finishes the day 7.4% higher after winning a $3.9B contract to build the first two trains at its planned Louisiana facility. The train construction, which could start next year and allow for liquified-natural-gas export as early as 2015, underscores the compay's efforts to start exporting its reserves of natural gas recently unlocked by shale drilling.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 3 Comments
  • EV

    Eaton Vance (EV -4.6%) is downgraded to Sell by Citigroup, which says the asset manager's shares...

    Eaton Vance (EV -4.6%) is downgraded to Sell by Citigroup, which says the asset manager's shares don't deserve in-line or premium valuations of "faster-growing and generally better strategically positioned players." EV is "clearly losing retail market share," while fund-flow trends are "negative" with the "least marketable Morningstar ratings among flagship funds."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • SLXP

    Salix (SLXP -9.5%) shares slump on heavy trading after the FDA raises questions about the...

    Salix (SLXP -9.5%) shares slump on heavy trading after the FDA raises questions about the drugmaker's non-constipation irritable bowel syndrome treatment Xifaxan ahead of a Nov. 16 committee meeting. Some experts believe the unexpected questions could complicate approval, although others expect the drug ultimately will be approved.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • MWE

    MarkWest Energy Partners (MWE +3%) gains on a Wells Fargo upgrade to Outperform from Market...

    MarkWest Energy Partners (MWE +3%) gains on a Wells Fargo upgrade to Outperform from Market Perform, citing the company's accelerated distribution growth forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • GTIV

    Gentiva Health Services (GTIV -4.6%) and LHC Group (LHCG -6%) both dip on a Stephens to...

    Gentiva Health Services (GTIV -4.6%) and LHC Group (LHCG -6%) both dip on a Stephens to equalweight from overweight. Stephens says the industry still faces the potential for more cuts and continued volatility over the near-to-mid term. (I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • BBXT

    Shares of Bluegreen Corp. (NYSE:BXG) soar over 43% after announcing it's agreed to an all-stock...

    Shares of Bluegreen Corp. (NYSE:BXG) soar over 43% after announcing it's agreed to an all-stock merger with BFC Financial, a diversified holding company based in Ft. Lauderdale, Florida. The timeshare and residential community manager will become a wholly-owned subsidiary of BFC once the deal is finalized.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • VNET

    Shares of 21Vianet Group (NASDAQ:VNET) jump up 8.1% after landing on Tiger Global's 13F filing....

    Shares of 21Vianet Group (NASDAQ:VNET) jump up 8.1% after landing on Tiger Global's 13F filing. The company scooped up 300K shares of the data services center company.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -1.4%) has sold off to a 5-week low, and a bearish note from Goldman's Bill Shope...

    Apple (AAPL -1.4%) has sold off to a 5-week low, and a bearish note from Goldman's Bill Shope could be playing a role. Shope is worried about a weak forecast from contract manufacturer Hon Hai Precision, and thinks it could be due to soft iPad demand. He adds that the release of a cheaper iPad could be needed to stoke demand, given the price-sensitivity of tablet buyers. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 3 Comments
  • LXRX

    Shares of Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) fall off 7.7% after the firm announces a $163M...

    Shares of Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) fall off 7.7% after the firm announces a $163M rights offering for stockholders. In the plan, one non-transferable subscription right will be received for every share of common stock owned as of Nov. 21. Each subscription right will entitle holders to purchase a pro rata number of shares of stock at a subscription price of $1.13/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • KKR

    KKR Financial (KFN +2%) ticks higher after a Barron's article over the weekend suggests that...

    KKR Financial (KFN +2%) ticks higher after a Barron's article over the weekend suggests that Europe's financial crisis presents an opportunity for the company to pick up distressed assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • MT

    ArcelorMittal (MT -2.4%) says its $1.5B in expansion projects in Brazil may be delayed for about...

    ArcelorMittal (MT -2.4%) says its $1.5B in expansion projects in Brazil may be delayed for about a year amid slowing demand growth in the Brazilian domestic market. The world's biggest steelmaker announced a Brazil delay during its Q3 earnings report, without specifying a timeline.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • BMY

    Baird raises its rating on Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN +5%) to Outperform from Neutral on...

    Baird raises its rating on Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN +5%) to Outperform from Neutral on valuation, citing optimism the company's break with Eli Lilly, and that its new drug Bydureon will be approved.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • LORL

    Satellite network operator Loral Space & Communications (LORL +2.1%) rises after announcing...

    Satellite network operator Loral Space & Communications (LORL +2.1%) rises after announcing an 800K share repurchase program - worth about $47M at current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-IO (FIO +7.9%) shares spike as the firm's Chief Scientist Steve Wozniak - yes, that Steve...

    Fusion-IO (FIO +7.9%) shares spike as the firm's Chief Scientist Steve Wozniak - yes, that Steve Wozniak - takes to the CNBC airwaves to talk about internet advances. He mostly talks about Apple (AAPL -1.2%), expressing faith in Tim Cook and Siri; he says little about his own company, but his remark that it's "growing as fast as Apple" is enough to send shares popping.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine (CPST +5.5%) jumps after the company announced earlier today that it was...

    Capstone Turbine (CPST +5.5%) jumps after the company announced earlier today that it was receiving the 2011 NOVA Award from the Construction Innovation Forum for its microturbine technology at Syracuse University's data center.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • AONEQ

    A123 (AONE -7.5%) is selling off again today, after Friday's report of a Chevy Volt catching...

    A123 (AONE -7.5%) is selling off again today, after Friday's report of a Chevy Volt catching fire at a testing center triggers a regulatory probe into the safety of lithium-ion car batteries. Shares are now down over 12% since the news broke. GM (GM +2%), however, is recovering from Friday's drop.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • SIGA

    Another Solyndra? LA Times reports the Obama administration has been pushing a $433M plan...

    Another Solyndra? LA Times reports the Obama administration has been pushing a $433M plan to buy Siga Technologies' (SIGA -9.1%) experimental smallpox drug, despite uncertainty over whether it is needed or will work at all. Siga, whose controlling shareholder is top Obama donor Ronald Perelman, was awarded a contract in May in a no-bid deal after the government's lead negotiator was replaced.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 17 Comments
  • GME

    GameStop (GME -2.2%) shares slip, partly in reaction to disappointing videogame sales data...

    GameStop (GME -2.2%) shares slip, partly in reaction to disappointing videogame sales data released late Friday that heightens concern ahead of its quarterly report later this week. Though Wall Street expects a slight GME earnings gain on a 3% rise in sales Y/Y, NPD data shows October U.S. sales of new videogame software fell 6.4% Y/Y, and game hardware sales fell 5.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • DANG

    China Dangdang (DANG +3.5%) - the country's Amazon -  bolts higher after Tiger Management...

    China Dangdang (DANG +3.5%) - the country's Amazon -  bolts higher after Tiger Management reveals a $21.7M stake in the company. (13F)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • AMZN

    Though the Kindle Fire is receiving less-than-glowing reviews, Amazon (AMZN +1.7%) is...

    Though the Kindle Fire is receiving less-than-glowing reviews, Amazon (AMZN +1.7%) is outperforming today, while Barnes & Noble (BKS -2.7%) is selling off after rallying strongly last week (I, II). An in-depth Wired interview with Jeff Bezos, in which he goes over Amazon's hardware, content, and web services strategies, could be giving bulls some encouragement.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • GEOY

    GeoEye (GEOY -7.3%) is selling off on a DealReporter story claiming its sale process has been...

    GeoEye (GEOY -7.3%) is selling off on a DealReporter story claiming its sale process has been suspended. Rival satellite imagery firm DigitalGlobe (DGI -3.1%) is also moving lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • EQT

    EQT Corp. (EQT -3%) trades lower after Pritchard Capital cut the shares to Neutral on valuation....

    EQT Corp. (EQT -3%) trades lower after Pritchard Capital cut the shares to Neutral on valuation. The firm said even if the energy company manages to do a joint-venture on its midstream assets, it would only give a slight boost to revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • TSN

    Tyson Foods (TSN +1.92%) moves higher after JP Morgan ups the shares to Overweight, citing...

    Tyson Foods (TSN +1.92%) moves higher after JP Morgan ups the shares to Overweight, citing better industry fundamentals and higher chicken and pork prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • MGI

    Shares of MoneyGram International (MGI -9.1%) shoot lower on heavy volume after the company...

    Shares of MoneyGram International (MGI -9.1%) shoot lower on heavy volume after the company announces a 1-for-8 reverse stock split and a 11.25M secondary share offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -3.99%) dips after Argus Research cuts the shares to Hold,...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -3.99%) dips after Argus Research cuts the shares to Hold, citing the company's recent earnings miss, concerns over K-cup patent expirations and accounting irregularities.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • DWA

    Dreamworks (DWA -2.8%) CEO Jeffrey Katzenberg says his company and Intel have developed new...

    Dreamworks (DWA -2.8%) CEO Jeffrey Katzenberg says his company and Intel have developed new animation software that will enable the company to operate 50-70x faster. He says the average animator now produces just three seconds of video a week, while the new technology will revolutionize the industry simply in terms of waiting.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (APKT +2.4%) moves up after Pacific Crest raises its rating to Outperform on...

    Acme Packet (APKT +2.4%) moves up after Pacific Crest raises its rating to Outperform on valuation, citing the company's new products partnerships, and growth opportunities.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • CTRP

    Shares of Ctrip.com (CTRP -13.6%) slump to their lowest intraday price since Nov. 2009 after the...

    Shares of Ctrip.com (CTRP -13.6%) slump to their lowest intraday price since Nov. 2009 after the company forecasts a drop in Q4 margins. Brean Murray cut its rating to Hold from Buy, noting that while EPS appeared to top estimates, profits included government subsidies equal to $0.06/share; without it, the company would have missed. Susquehanna also cut its rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • QEP

    QEP Resources (QEP -6.6%) is the S&P's biggest loser at the noon hour after the oil and gas...

    QEP Resources (QEP -6.6%) is the S&P's biggest loser at the noon hour after the oil and gas exploration company downwardly revises its 2012 EBITDA forecast to $1.45B-$1.55B, missing the consensus $1.62B. The company expects 12%-14% 2012 organic production growth, below its year-ago 2011 annual production growth projection in the mid-teens.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • GEOS

    OYO Geospace (OYOG +3%), a maker of equipment for analyzing seismic data and oil/gas reservoirs,...

    OYO Geospace (OYOG +3%), a maker of equipment for analyzing seismic data and oil/gas reservoirs, trades higher following an upgrade to Buy from Global Hunter Securities. While deeming long-term visibility to be non-existent given the nature of OYO's business. the firm thinks strong near-term bookings will translate into record earnings in FY12.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • BCO

    Brink's (BCO -4.4%) shares slide on news of the resignation of CEO Michael Dan and the...

    Brink's (BCO -4.4%) shares slide on news of the resignation of CEO Michael Dan and the appointment of board member Thomas Schievelbein as interim CEO. Dan has worked for the provider of secure transportation and cash management services since 1982.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • CECO

    Career Education (CECO +6.5%) gains after announcing it's sold Istituto Marangoni, its fashion...

    Career Education (CECO +6.5%) gains after announcing it's sold Istituto Marangoni, its fashion and design education unit, to an affiliate of private-equity firm Providence Equity Partners. Financial terms weren't disclosed, but the company said that it should record a $17M - $20M gain from the sale. Separately, the company also says its adding an additional $100M to its share buyback.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America’s (BAC -2.2%) decision to sell its stake in China Construction Bank - with...

    Bank of America’s (BAC -2.2%) decision to sell its stake in China Construction Bank - with its potential to grow into a global bank - smacks of desperation, David Weidner writes. True, surviving the short-term is Brian Moynihan's first order of business, but selling the stake reminds Weidner of "a mortgage borrower dipping into their 401(k) to make the monthly mortgage payment."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 5 Comments
  • DXC

    Computer Sciences (CSC -3.93%) turns lower again today after S&P put the company on watch...

    Computer Sciences (CSC -3.93%) turns lower again today after S&P put the company on watch for a possible downgrade, just two days after the IT service provider reported a $2.9B FQ2 loss and lowered guidance. The ratings agency cites concerns over the company's high charge-offs during the reported quarter, plus the questionable status of its U.K. National Health Service contracts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • PARR

    Delta Petroleum (DPTR -8.3%) trades lower after S&P cut the shares a notch further into junk...

    Delta Petroleum (DPTR -8.3%) trades lower after S&P cut the shares a notch further into junk territory and lowered its outlook to negative late Friday. The move comes two days after the oil-and-natural-gas company said it would likely need to restructure its debt in a move that could include Chapter 11. The stock has fallen hard since hitting a 52-week high near $13 in early March, dwindling down to just pennies on the dollar over mounting debt problems.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • AAL

    American Eagle Airlines (AMR -2.2%) is ordered to pay a $900,000 fine for 15 planes that sat on...

    American Eagle Airlines (AMR -2.2%) is ordered to pay a $900,000 fine for 15 planes that sat on a Chicago O'Hare Airport runway for more than three hours in May, the Department of Transportation announces. The fine is the first since new U.S. rules were established in 2010 setting a three-hour limit for tarmac delays on domestic flights.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • GRRF

    China GrenTech's (GRRF +14.1%) board says its CEO offered to purchase the remaining stake in the...

    China GrenTech's (GRRF +14.1%) board says its CEO offered to purchase the remaining stake in the company that he does not already own, a bid that values the wireless service provider at $73.4M. The offer of $3.10/share marks a 21% premium to Friday’s $2.56 closing price. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • MNK

    Cadence Pharmaceuticals (CADX -15.8%) takes a hit after announcing plans for a $75M secondary...

    Cadence Pharmaceuticals (CADX -15.8%) takes a hit after announcing plans for a $75M secondary stock offering. The company plans to use the majority of the funds for research and development of its injectable acetaminophen drug Ofirmev.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • DAR

    Darling International (DAR +2.6%) receives attention from analysts - led off with Ardour...

    Darling International (DAR +2.6%) receives attention from analysts - led off with Ardour Capital's Buy rating and 12-month price estimate of $20. Canaccord Genuity comes in with a more sedate outlook, placing a Hold rating and $16 PT on shares based on operations at the company it sees as "relatively resilient."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • BMR

    BioMed Realty Trust (BMR -3.68%) prices its 22.6M share secondary offering at $17.92 per share,...

    BioMed Realty Trust (BMR -3.68%) prices its 22.6M share secondary offering at $17.92 per share, a 4.5% discount to Friday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • ISS

    iSoftStone (ISS +9.2%) shoots higher after reporting Q3 revenue of $73.7M (+44% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    iSoftStone (ISS +9.2%) shoots higher after reporting Q3 revenue of $73.7M (+44% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.15, beating Street estimates by $0.4M and a penny. The Chinese IT services firm, which says it hasn't been affected yet by global macro issues, expects Q4 revenue of $84.4M-$86.4M and EPS of $0.18; the former is above an $82.5M consensus, while the latter is in-line. (Q2 results)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • MCO

    Moody's (MCO -3.2%) acuires a majority stake in institutional research firm Copal Partners for...

    Moody's (MCO -3.2%) acuires a majority stake in institutional research firm Copal Partners for an undisclosed sum. The ratings agency says the purchase will add to depth to its analytical and professional services businesses in India and China, and should give a boost to its FY12 earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • MNK

    Cadence Pharmaceuticals (CADX) trades 13.1% lower after announcing a plan to sell $75M of common...

    Cadence Pharmaceuticals (CADX) trades 13.1% lower after announcing a plan to sell $75M of common stock on a market cap sitting south of $300M. Undeterred by the firm's new public offering of shares, Colins Stewart initiates coverage with a Buy rating and a lofty $7 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • BRLI

    Jefferies drops coverage of Bio-Reference Laboratories (NASDAQ:BRLI) following corruption...

    Jefferies drops coverage of Bio-Reference Laboratories (NASDAQ:BRLI) following corruption allegations from The Street Sweeper that roils investors. Shares of BRLI, up 2.9% on the day, are still off 50% from their YTD high.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • UNCFF

    Unicredit resumes trading, -9% in its first prints after being halted before its earnings...

    Unicredit resumes trading, -9% in its first prints after being halted before its earnings release. Europe at session lows, Stoxx 50 -1.7%. Italy -2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • UNCFF

    Shares are halted in Italy's Unicredit after the announcement of a €10.6B loss in Q3...

    Shares are halted in Italy's Unicredit after the announcement of a €10.6B loss in Q3 against expectations of a €7.4B profit. The bank will slash 5.2K jobs, eliminate its dividend, and proceed with a capital raise of €7.5B (market cap is €15B). Unicredit is the only Italian lender among 29 financials worldwide considered systemically important financial institutions. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM | 5 Comments
  • CRAY

    Cray (NASDAQ:CRAY) is awarded a $188M contract from a University of Illinois research center to...

    Cray (NASDAQ:CRAY) is awarded a $188M contract from a University of Illinois research center to build one of the world's most powerful supercomputers, an effort IBM worked on for years before giving up in August. Cray forecasts 2012 revenue of $340M-$360M, with the new contract expected to contribute ~40%. The machine will include parts from Cray, AMD and NVDA. CRAY +17.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • CPST

    Premarket gainers: GCVRZ +18%. CPST +6%. BA +3%. VVUS +3%. GLW +3%.Losers: CTRP -12%. AEG -3%....

    Premarket gainers: GCVRZ +18%. CPST +6%. BA +3%. VVUS +3%. GLW +3%.
    Losers: CTRP -12%. AEG -3%. NOK -3%. ARMH -3%. GGB -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM) is raised to Buy from Neutral at Citigroup, with a new target price of...

    Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM) is raised to Buy from Neutral at Citigroup, with a new target price of $158 from $122, reflecting greater confidence in medium-term growth and more credit for call options in early markets. The company’s Service Cloud "was a call option but is now a tangible driver and likely [to] be underestimated by the Street." CRM +2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM | 4 Comments
  • BA

    Shares of Boeing (NYSE:BA) tack on a 2.2% gain premarket after landing several contracts (I, II)...

    Shares of Boeing (NYSE:BA) tack on a 2.2% gain premarket after landing several contracts (I, II) at the Dubai Air Show from Mideast buyers. Nomura analyst Jason Adams says (video) the firm's 787 is an incredibly good value proposition that has Gulf-region countries placing orders at a pace that may outstrip demand if economic growth doesn't sustain.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • LYB

    Dutch chemical giant LyondellBasell (NYSE:LYB) gains 3% after boosting its quarterly dividend by...

    Dutch chemical giant LyondellBasell (NYSE:LYB) gains 3% after boosting its quarterly dividend by $0.05/share, to $0.25/share, and announcing a one-time dividend of $4.50/share, to be paid on Dec. 16.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • CTRP

    Shares of Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP) fall 7.8% premarket after the firm reports a...

    Shares of Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP) fall 7.8% premarket after the firm reports a better-than-expected Q3 profit, warding off a higher effective tax rate and lower margins. The Chinese travel services provider sees Q4 net revenue growth of 15%-20%, a range that stands below the consensus estimate of analysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM

  • EU shares open up as EU technocrats take over in Greece and Italy, with banks leading the way....

    EU shares open up as EU technocrats take over in Greece and Italy, with banks leading the way. STOXX Europe 600 Banks index +1.5%, Euro STOXX 50 +0.65%, London +0.3%, Paris +0.2%, Frankfurt +0.7%, Milan +2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 AM
